The 3R project in Ethiopia is designed to promote the 3R approaches among governmental bodies, NGOs and communities through participatory training of trainers (ToT), publication and dissemination of knowledge materials and research. The project areas are Afar, Oromia and SNNPR.

The DWA targets arid/semi-arid zones in Ethiopia. Most of the arid zones are located in the lowlands. The arid lowlands are often the harshest of environments but also buffer management techniques in such areas are less well known. These areas encounter various water related problems such as water availability in dry seasons and water quality. 3R approach rehabilitate the water retention capacity of water sources and create sustainable buffering zones. Better buffer management in these areas will help sustain the source (or create new ones) for water supply systems, facilitate self supply system and contribute to livestock watering, hence serving the economy

The project will carry out the following activities through its course • Trainings (ToT) and Review of ToT assignments (3R ToT plans) • Identification of new 3R ToT pilot areas • Secondary data retrieval (for baseline report) and Baseline report compilation • Attend and contribute to EWA joint activities • Engage and carry out joint activities with selected EWA partners • Audio- visual material development • Data mining, data processing and reporting • Translation of modules to Amharic and/or Oromo • 3R plans implementation (coaching) • Attendance and presentation of showcase in international conference (sernet)

The projects have the following objectives: • To introduce water buffer management to the target areas • To strengthen 3R commitment of institutions and local organizations (EWA and others) • To discover, investigate and document 3R case • To create the basis for a methodology to roll-out 3R
